author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Chief Judicial Magistrate court has issued copies of the charge sheet in the sensational Gokulraj murder case to the prime accused S. Yuvaraj and 16 others in Namakkal on Thursday.

The accused, of whom seven were detained under Goondas Act, and are out on bail appeared before the CJM S. Malarmathy, who ordered copies of the charge sheet to be served on them.

The Magistrate said that since the case was registered under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, the trial would be transferred to the Principal District Judge court and directed all accused to appear before the PDJ on March 17.

Yuvaraj, a detainee under the Goondas Act, was brought from Vellore Central Prison amid tight security. Cadres of the Dheeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai raised slogans hailing Yuvaraj while he was taken in a police vehicle after the court proceedings.

He was later produced before a court in Perundurai in Erode where he is facing charges of abduction. Six others who were detained under the Goondas Act were later lodged at Salem Central Prison. Yuvaraj’s wife Suveethan and over 75 supporters of the Peravai were present.
title: Charge sheet served on 17 accused in Gokulraj case
